user.title: Step 1 of 4: Meraki Credentials
user.description: Enter your Meraki API Key and Organization ID.

data_description.meraki_api_key: Your personal API key for the Meraki Dashboard.
data_description.meraki_org_id: The ID of the Meraki Organization you want to add.

general.title: Step 2 of 4: General Settings
general.description: Configure general settings for the Meraki integration.

data_description.scan_interval: How often to poll the Meraki API for updates, in seconds.
data_description.device_name_format: Choose how devices should be named in Home Assistant.

features.title: Step 3 of 4: Feature Settings
features.description: Enable or disable specific features of the integration.

data.use_lan_ip_for_rtsp: Use LAN IP for RTSP stream

data_description.auto_enable_rtsp: Automatically enable the RTSP stream for compatible cameras.
data_description.use_lan_ip_for_rtsp: Use the camera's LAN IP address for the RTSP stream. Requires local network access.
data_description.enable_device_tracker: Enable tracking of clients connected to the network.
data_description.enable_web_ui: Enable the self-hosted web interface for advanced controls.
data_description.web_ui_port: The port for the self-hosted web interface.
data_description.hide_unconfigured_ssids: Hide SSIDs that are not fully configured.

advanced.title: Step 4 of 4: Advanced Settings
advanced.description: Configure advanced settings for the Meraki integration.

data_description.webhook_url: The publicly accessible URL for Meraki webhooks. Leave empty to use Home Assistant's cloud link.
data_description.ignored_networks: A comma-separated list of network IDs to ignore.

abort.already_configured: This Meraki organization is already configured.

init.title: Meraki Options - Basic Settings
init.description: Step 1 of 4: Configure basic integration settings.

data_description.scan_interval: How often to poll the Meraki API for updates, in seconds.
data_description.enable_device_tracker: Enable tracking of clients connected to the network.
data_description.enabled_networks: Select which networks to monitor. Leave empty for all networks.

dashboard.title: Meraki Options - Dashboard Settings
dashboard.description: Step 2 of 4: Configure dashboard display preferences.

data_description.dashboard_view_mode: Choose how devices are grouped on the dashboard (by network or by device type).
data_description.dashboard_device_type_filter: Default filter for device types on the dashboard.
data_description.dashboard_status_filter: Default filter for device status on the dashboard.
data_description.temperature_unit: Choose the unit for temperature readings from Meraki sensors (Celsius or Fahrenheit).

data_description.camera_snapshot_interval: How often to refresh camera snapshots on the dashboard (0 = only on demand). Camera streaming uses RTSP and requires the RTSP server to be enabled in the Meraki Dashboard.
data_description.camera_link_integration: Select an integration to filter which cameras are shown when linking Meraki cameras. Choose 'All Cameras' to see all available camera entities.

mqtt.title: Meraki Options - MQTT Settings
mqtt.description:
Step 4 of 4: Configure MQTT for MT sensor real-time updates.

Configured relay destinations: {relay_destinations}

data_description.enable_mqtt: Enable MQTT to receive real-time updates from MT sensors via Home Assistant's Mosquitto broker. When enabled, API polling for sensor readings is disabled.

mqtt_destination.title: Add MQTT Relay Destination
mqtt_destination.description: Configure an external MQTT broker to relay Meraki sensor data to.

data_description.name: A friendly name for this relay destination (e.g., 'IoT Platform').
data_description.host: The hostname or IP address of the external MQTT broker.
data_description.port: The port of the MQTT broker (default: 1883, or 8883 for TLS).
data_description.use_tls: Enable TLS encryption for the connection.
data_description.topic_filter: Topic pattern to match (e.g., 'meraki/v1/mt/#' for all MT sensors).
data_description.device_types: Optionally filter by specific device types.
